byline.original: By VIKAS BAJAJ and SRUTHI GOTTIPATI
byline.contributor: Vikas Bajaj reported from Mumbai, India, and Sruthi Gottipati from New Delhi and Manesar, India.

abstract: Relations between workers and management at Maruti Suzuki’s plant in Manesar, and at other Indian automotive companies, have been marred by a series of strikes and lockouts; dispute pits the aspirations of manufacturing workers against the economic realities of a national labor glut.
snippet: Relations between workers and management at Maruti Suzuki’s plant in Manesar, and at other Indian automotive companies, have been marred by a series of strikes and lockouts this year.
lead_paragraph: Relations between workers and management at Maruti Suzuki’s plant in Manesar, and at other Indian automotive companies, have been marred by a series of strikes and lockouts this year.

headline.main: Strike Adds to Problems at Indian Auto Plant
headline.print_headline: Strike Adds to Labor Problems for India’s Largest Auto Company
headline.seo: Strike Adds to Problems at Indian Auto Plant
